ygData.subject: Re: Cut and Paste form EQ'Lizer
ygData.msgSnippet: What Verant needs to do and I think trys to do is provide distinction among the classes without having any one class over-shadow all of the others.   Although
ygData.messageBody:
What Verant needs to do and I think trys to do is provide distinction among
the classes without having any one class over-shadow all of the others.
�
Although my experience is minimal compared to your (my level 13 and your
level 43 (44?)), I would support your petition to ensure that the warrior
class is made to be distictive and the one true melee combat class.� If
Verant has erred somewhere by allowing all of the "add-on" things of the
hybrid classes to cause these classes to compete with or go further than the
warriors in the higher levels, then they need to do something to fix it.
�
I'd hate to spend all my time getting to where you are and end up feeling
like it was just not worth it.
�
Snyak

-----Original Message-----
From: James Wofford [mailto:James.Wofford@...]
Sent: Thursday, June 10, 1999 1:28 PM
To: warriors_eq@onelist.com
Subject: Re: [warriors_eq] Cut and Paste form EQ'Lizer


I am not actually board with my character, just tired of waiting for the
goodies to come when they are actually no where to be found.� They will
never get to us, and we are outweighed even in a group setting by other
melee classes.
�
I am not so concerned about the magic using/healing/gating part of this as I
am the fact that the masters of physical combat (warriors) are anything but
that.� Healing never has been IMO a part of what a warrior can do.� But a
warrior is supposed to be the master or armed combat.� When we cap out at
skill level 200 and others can go beyond that as well as do more damage than
us warrior, something is definitely wrong.� I think we should start a
pettition to verant to try to even things out a bit more.� The suggestions
in this post on EQ`Lizer for modifying the Warrior class are well thought
and not too much to ask.�
�
If anyone else is at all interested in starting a pettition, I will get
things going.� Just let me know and I can get things rolling on it....� Even
if you dont respond to me on this, I will get things going anyways.�

-----Original Message-----
From: Elena Glenn [ mailto:braveheart@...
<mailto:braveheart@...> ]
Sent: Thursday, June 10, 1999 11:27 AM
To: warriors_eq@onelist.com <mailto:warriors_eq@onelist.com>
Subject: [warriors_eq] Cut and Paste form EQ'Lizer


James....I also am getting a little bored with my level 19 Barbarian
Warrior.� One of the reasons, I guess, that I started the Bard.� I do think
that Verant has overlooked us slightly.� When I played Realm, the warrior on
there could buy mana and cast spells.� Agreed, they didn't work as well as
the mages did, but we still could have the basics.� I would like to see
Verant come up with another plan.� Perhaps some sort of magic skill, so at
the very least, we could gate and cast healing on ourselves.�
�
Leri
